noun.description: A colourless crystalline compound, C₁₅H₁₄O₄, which has a tricyclic molecule containing fused coumarin and furan rings and occurs in the root of hog's fennel, Peucedanum officinale, and in certain other plants of the family Apiaceae (Umbelliferae).

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Records of General Science. From German Peucedaninum from scientific Latin Peucedanum + -inum.
